info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 12:52PM CDT until August 27 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria and Harris.
* WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1252 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Pearland, South Houston, Greater Hobby Area, Brookside Village, Golfcrest / Bellfort / Reveille, Minnetex, South Acres / Crestmont Park, South Park, Sunnyside, Hobby Airport, Greater Ost / South Union, Gulfgate Riverview / Pine Valley, Pecan Park, Park Place, southeastern Central Southwest, Meadowbrook / Allendale and Harrisburg / Manchester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
